conflictDescription: User Story A wants ALFRED to be always active and listening all day without user action, but User Story B requires ALFRED to listen only when the user activates push-to-talk, which means ALFRED must not listen otherwise. These two cannot be true at the same time.
conflictingNfrPairs: ALFRED is always ready to respond to user commands
ALFRED does not listen without push-to-talk activation
ALFRED stays active throughout the day without user action
Push-to-talk works only when the user activates it
ALFRED provides continuous support without delays
ALFRED does not listen without push-to-talk activation
userStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to be always ready and active, so I feel supported without doing anything.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want to use push-to-talk only when I ask, so I feel safe and control ALFRED's listening.
resolutionDescription: We update both stories to allow ALFRED to listen continuously but with privacy options. Story A keeps ALFRED always ready but with controls. Story B adds push-to-talk as a privacy mode, not the only way to listen.
newUserStoryASummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to be always ready to respond, so I feel supported without delays.
newUserStoryADecomposition: ALFRED allows privacy control over listening
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to listen only when I activate push-to-talk or privacy mode is off, so I feel safe and in control.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: ALFRED listens only after push-to-talk activation or if privacy mode is off
ALFRED does not listen when privacy mode is on and push-to-talk is inactive
